declarations.comments:
The `ComonadEnv` type class extends `ComonadAsk` with a function
`local f x` that allows the value of the local context to be modified for
the duration of the execution of action `x`.

An implementation is provided for `EnvT`.

Laws:

- `ask (local f x) = f (ask x)`
- `extract (local _ x) = extract a`
- `extend g (local f x) = extend (g <<< local f) x`
declarations.title: ComonadEnv

declarations.comments: Get a value which depends on the environment.
declarations.title: asks

declarations.comments:

declarations.comments:
The `ComonadStore` type class represents those monads which support local position information via
`pos` and `peek`.

- `pos` reads the current position.
- `peek` reads the value at the specified position in the specified context.

An implementation is provided for `StoreT`.

Laws:

- `pos (extend _ x) = pos x`
- `peek (pos x) x = extract x`

For example:

```purescript
blur :: forall w. (ComonadStore Number w) -> w Number -> w Number
blur = extend \r -> (peeks (\n -> n - 1) r + peeks (\n -> n + 1) r) / 2)
```
declarations.title: ComonadStore

declarations.comments: Reposition the focus at the specified position, which depends on the current position.
declarations.title: seeks

declarations.comments: Reposition the focus at the specified position.
declarations.title: seek

declarations.comments: Extract a value from a position which depends on the current position.
declarations.title: peeks

declarations.comments: Extract a collection of values from positions which depend on the current position.
declarations.title: experiment

declarations.comments:
The store comonad transformer.

This comonad transformer extends the context of a value in the base comonad so that the value
depends on a position of type `s`.

The `ComonadStore` type class describes the operations supported by this comonad.
declarations.title: StoreT

declarations.comments: Unwrap a value in the `StoreT` comonad.
declarations.title: runStoreT

For example:

```purescript
blur :: forall w. (ComonadStore Number w) -> w Number -> w Number
blur = extend \r -> (peeks (\n -> n - 1) r + peeks (\n -> n + 1) r) / 2)
```
declarations.title: ComonadStore

declarations.comments:
The store comonad transformer.

This comonad transformer extends the context of a value in the base comonad so that the value

declarations.comments:
The `ComonadTraced` type class represents those monads which support relative (monoidal)
position information via `track`.

- `track` extracts a value at the specified relative position.

An implementation is provided for `TracedT`.

Laws:

- `track mempty = extract`
- `(track s =<= track t) x = track (s <> t) x`

For example:

```purescript
blur :: forall w. (ComonadTraced (Additive Number) w) -> w Number -> w Number
blur = extend \r -> (track (Additive (-1)) r + track (Additive 1) r) / 2
```
declarations.title: ComonadTraced

declarations.comments: Extracts a value at a relative position which depends on the current value.
declarations.title: tracks

declarations.comments: Get a value which depends on the current position.
declarations.title: listens

declarations.comments: Get the current position.
declarations.title: listen

declarations.comments: Apply a function to the current position.
declarations.title: censor

This comonad transformer extends the context of a value in the base comonad so that the value

modules.name: Control.Comonad.Trans.Class
modules.comments: This module defines the `ComonadTrans` type class of _comonad transformers_.

declarations.comments:
The `ComonadTrans` type class represents _comonad transformers_.

A comonad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Comonad` as its first argument, and returns another `Comonad`.

This allows us to extend a comonad to provide additional context. By iterating this
process, we create comonad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the contextual information
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lower` is a `Comonad` morphism.

Laws:

- `extract (lower a) = extract a`
- `lower (extend w (f <<< lower)) = extend (lower w) f`
declarations.title: ComonadTrans

declarations.comments:
The `MonadCont` type class represents those monads which support the
`callCC`, or _call-with-current-continuation_ operation.

This action makes the current continuation available to the caller.

For example:

```purescript
delay :: forall eff. Number -> ContT Unit (Eff (timeout :: Timeout | eff)) Unit
delay n = callCC \cont ->
  lift $ setTimeout n (runContT (cont unit) (\_ -> return unit))
```
An implementation is provided for `ContT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.
declarations.title: MonadCont

declarations.comments:
The CPS monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad with the operation `callCC`.
declarations.title: ContT

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this
process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (pure a) = pure a`
- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
declarations.title: MonadTrans

declarations.comments: Modify the continuation in a `ContT` monad action
declarations.title: withContT

declarations.comments: Run a computation in the `ContT` monad, by providing a continuation.
declarations.title: runContT

declarations.comments: Modify the underlying action in a `ContT` monad action.
declarations.title: mapContT

modules.name: Control.Monad.Cont
modules.comments: This module defines the `Cont`inuation monad.

declarations.comments:

This action makes the current continuation available to the caller.

For example:

```purescript
delay :: forall eff. Number -> ContT Unit (Eff (timeout :: Timeout | eff)) Unit
delay n = callCC \cont ->
  lift $ setTimeout n (runContT (cont unit) (\_ -> return unit))
```
An implementation is provided for `ContT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.
declarations.title: MonadCont

declarations.comments:
The `MonadCont` type class represents those monads which support the
`callCC`, or _call-with-current-continuation_ operation.

modules.name: Control.Monad.Error.Class
modules.comments: This module defines the `MonadError` type class and its instances.

declarations.comments:
The `MonadThrow` type class represents those monads which support errors via
`throwError`, where `throwError e` halts, yielding the error `e`.

An implementation is provided for `ExceptT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- Left zero: `throwError e >>= f = throwError e`
declarations.title: MonadThrow

declarations.comments:
The `MonadError` type class represents those monads which support catching
errors.

- `catchError x f` calls the error handler `f` if an error is thrown during the
  evaluation of `x`.

An implementation is provided for `ExceptT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- Catch: `catchError (throwError e) f = f e`
- Pure: `catchError (pure a) f = pure a`
declarations.title: MonadError

declarations.comments:
This function allows you to provide a predicate for selecting the
exceptions that you're interested in, and handle only those exceptons.
If the inner computation throws an exception, and the predicate returns
Nothing, then the whole computation will still fail with that exception.
declarations.title: catchJust

declarations.comments: Return `Right` if the given action succeeds, `Left` if it throws.
declarations.title: try

declarations.comments:
Make sure that a resource is cleaned up in the event of an exception. The
release action is called regardless of whether the body action throws or
returns.
declarations.title: withResource

declarations.comments:
The `MonadError` type class represents those monads which support catching
errors.

- `catchError x f` calls the error handler `f` if an error is thrown during the
  evaluation of `x`.

An implementation is provided for `ExceptT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- Catch: `catchError (throwError e) f = f e`
- Pure: `catchError (pure a) f = pure a`
declarations.title: MonadError

declarations.comments:
This function allows you to provide a predicate for selecting the
exceptions that you're interested in, and handle only those exceptons.
If the inner computation throws an exception, and the predicate returns
Nothing, then the whole computation will still fail with that exception.
declarations.title: catchJust

declarations.comments:
A monad transformer which adds exceptions to other monads, in the same way
as `Except`. As before, `e` is the type of exceptions, and `a` is the type
of successful results. The new type parameter `m` is the inner monad that
computations run in.
declarations.title: ExceptT

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this
process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (pure a) = pure a`
- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
declarations.title: MonadTrans

declarations.comments: Transform any exceptions thrown by an `ExceptT` computation using the given function.
declarations.title: withExceptT

declarations.comments: The inverse of `ExceptT`. Run a computation in the `ExceptT` monad.
declarations.title: runExceptT

declarations.comments: Transform the unwrapped computation using the given function.
declarations.title: mapExceptT

declarations.comments: Construct a computation in the `ExceptT` transformer from an `Either` value.
declarations.title: except

declarations.comments:
A parametrizable exception monad; computations are either exceptions or
pure values. If an exception is thrown (see `throwError`), the computation
terminates with that value. Exceptions may also be caught with `catchError`,
allowing the computation to resume and exit successfully.

The type parameter `e` is the type of exceptions, and `a` is the type
of successful results.

A mechanism for trying many different computations until one succeeds is
provided via the `Alt` instance, specifically the `(<|>)` function.
The first computation to succeed is returned; if all fail, the exceptions
are combined using their `Semigroup` instance. The `Plus` instance goes
further and adds the possibility of a computation failing with an 'empty'
exception; naturally, this requires the stronger constraint of a `Monoid`
instance for the exception type.
declarations.title: Except

declarations.comments: Run a computation in the `Except` monad. The inverse of `except`.
declarations.title: runExcept

declarations.comments: Transform the unwrapped computation using the given function.
declarations.title: mapExcept

declarations.comments: Transform any exceptions thrown by an `Except` computation using the given function.
declarations.title: withExcept

declarations.comments:
The `MonadError` type class represents those monads which support catching
errors.

- `catchError x f` calls the error handler `f` if an error is thrown during the
  evaluation of `x`.

An implementation is provided for `ExceptT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- Catch: `catchError (throwError e) f = f e`
- Pure: `catchError (pure a) f = pure a`
declarations.title: MonadError

declarations.comments:
The `MonadThrow` type class represents those monads which support errors via
`throwError`, where `throwError e` halts, yielding the error `e`.

An implementation is provided for `ExceptT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- Left zero: `throwError e >>= f = throwError e`
declarations.title: MonadThrow

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this
process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (pure a) = pure a`
- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
declarations.title: MonadTrans

A monad transformer which adds exceptions to other monads, in the same way
as `Except`. As before, `e` is the type of exceptions, and `a` is the type
of successful results. The new type parameter `m` is the inner monad that
computations run in.

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this

modules.name: Control.Monad.List.Trans
modules.comments: This module defines the list monad transformer, `ListT`.

declarations.comments:
The list monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad with _non-determinism_.
That is, the transformed monad supports the same effects as the base monad
but with multiple return values.
declarations.title: ListT

declarations.comments:
The result of a single step in a `ListT` computation. Either:

- Computation has finished (`Done`), or
- A result has been returned, along with the next part of the computation (`Yield`).

The `Skip` constructor allows us to avoid traversing lists during certain operations.
declarations.title: Step

declarations.comments: Remove elements from a list which do not contain a value.
declarations.title: catMaybes

declarations.comments: Attach an element to the front of a list.
declarations.title: cons

declarations.comments: Drop a number of elements from the front of a list.
declarations.title: drop

declarations.comments: Drop elements from the front of a list while a predicate holds.
declarations.title: dropWhile

declarations.comments: Remove elements from a list for which a predicate fails to hold.
declarations.title: filter

declarations.comments: Fold a list from the left, accumulating the result using the specified function.
declarations.title: foldl

declarations.comments:
Fold a list from the left, accumulating the result using the specified function.
Uses tail call optimization.
declarations.title: foldlRec

declarations.comments: Fold a list from the left, accumulating the result (effectfully) using the specified function.
declarations.title: foldl'

declarations.comments:
Fold a list from the left, accumulating the result (effectfully) using the specified function.
Uses tail call optimization.
declarations.title: foldlRec'

declarations.comments: Lift a computation from the base functor.
declarations.title: fromEffect

declarations.comments: Extract the first element of a list.
declarations.title: head

declarations.comments: Generate an infinite list by iterating a function.
declarations.title: iterate

declarations.comments: Apply a function to the elements of a list, keeping only those return values which contain a result.
declarations.title: mapMaybe

declarations.comments: The empty list.
declarations.title: nil

declarations.comments: Prepend an element to a list.
declarations.title: prepend

declarations.comments: Prepend an element to a lazily-evaluated list.
declarations.title: prepend'

declarations.comments: Generate an infinite list by repeating a value.
declarations.title: repeat

declarations.comments: Drain a `ListT`, running it to completion and discarding all values.
declarations.title: runListT

declarations.comments:
Drain a `ListT`, running it to completion and discarding all values.
Stack safe: Uses tail call optimization.
declarations.title: runListTRec

declarations.comments: Fold a list from the left, accumulating the list of results using the specified function.
declarations.title: scanl

declarations.comments: Create a list with one element.
declarations.title: singleton

declarations.comments: Extract all but the first element of a list.
declarations.title: tail

declarations.comments: Take a number of elements from the front of a list.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Take elements from the front of a list while a predicate holds.
declarations.title: takeWhile

declarations.comments: Perform the first step of a computation in the `ListT` monad.
declarations.title: uncons

declarations.comments: Unfold a list using an effectful generator function.
declarations.title: unfold

declarations.comments: Lift a computation from the base monad.
declarations.title: wrapEffect

declarations.comments: Defer evaluation of a list.
declarations.title: wrapLazy

declarations.comments: Zip the elements of two lists, combining elements at the same position from each list.
declarations.title: zipWith

declarations.comments: Zip the elements of two lists, combining elements at the same position from each list.
declarations.title: zipWith'

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this
process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (pure a) = pure a`
- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
declarations.title: MonadTrans

modules.name: Control.Monad.Maybe.Trans
modules.comments: This module defines the `MaybeT` monad transformer.

declarations.comments:
The `MaybeT` monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad, supporting failure and alternation via
the `MonadPlus` type class.
declarations.title: MaybeT

declarations.comments: Run a computation in the `MaybeT` monad.
declarations.title: runMaybeT

declarations.comments: Change the result type of a `MaybeT` monad action.
declarations.title: mapMaybeT

declarations.comments:
The reader-writer-state monad transformer, which combines the operations
of `ReaderT`, `WriterT` and `StateT` into a single monad transformer.
declarations.title: RWST

declarations.comments:
The `MonadAsk` type class represents those monads which support a global
context that can be provided via the `ask` function.

An implementation is provided for `ReaderT`, and for other monad
transformers defined in this library.

Law:

- `do { ask ; ask } = ask`
declarations.title: MonadAsk

declarations.comments:
An extension of the `MonadAsk` class that introduces a function `local f x`
that allows the value of the local context to be modified for the duration
of the execution of action `x`.

An implementation is provided for `ReaderT`, and for other monad
transformers defined in this library.

Laws in addition to the `MonadAsk` law:

- `local f ask = f <$> ask`
- `local _ (pure a) = pure a`
- `local f (do { a <- x ; y }) = do { a <- local f x ; local f y }`
declarations.title: MonadReader

declarations.comments: Projects a value from the global context in a `MonadAsk`.
declarations.title: asks

declarations.comments:
The reader monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad transformer with a _global context_ of
type `r`.

The `MonadReader` type class describes the operations supported by this monad.
declarations.title: ReaderT

declarations.title: runReaderT

declarations.comments:
The `MonadState s` type class represents those monads which support a single piece of mutable
state of type `s`.

- `state f` updates the state using the function `f`.

An implementation is provided for `StateT`, and for other monad transformers
defined in this library.

Laws:

- `do { get ; get } = get`
- `do { put x ; put y } = put y`
- `do { put x ; get } = put x $> x`
- `do { s <- get ; put s } = pure unit`
declarations.title: MonadState

declarations.comments: Set the state.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments:
Modify the state by applying a function to the current state. The returned
value is the new state value.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Get a value which depends on the current state.
declarations.title: gets

declarations.comments: Get the current state.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
The state monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad with the operations `get`
and `put` which can be used to model a single piece of mutable state.

The `MonadState` type class describes the operations supported by this monad.
declarations.title: StateT

declarations.comments: Modify the final state in a `StateT` monad action.

modules.name: Control.Monad.Trans.Class
modules.comments: This module defines the `MonadTrans` type class of _monad transformers_.

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTrans` type class represents _monad transformers_.

A monad transformer is a type constructor of kind `(* -> *) -> * -> *`, which
takes a `Monad` as its first argument, and returns another `Monad`.

This allows us to add additional effects to an existing monad. By iterating this
process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (pure a) = pure a`
- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
declarations.title: MonadTrans

declarations.comments:
The `MonadTell w` type class represents those monads which support a
monoidal accumulator of type `w`, were `tell` appends a value to the
accumulator.

An implementation is provided for `WriterT`, and for other monad
transformers defined in this library.

Law:

- `do { tell x ; tell y } = tell (x <> y)`
declarations.title: MonadTell

declarations.comments:
An extension of the `MonadTell` class that introduces some operations on
the accumulator:

- `listen` modifies the result to include the changes to the accumulator.
- `pass` applies the returned function to the accumulator.

An implementation is provided for `WriterT`, and for other monad
transformers defined in this library.

Laws in addition to the `MonadTell` law:

- `do { tell x ; tell y } = tell (x <> y)`
- `listen (pure a) = pure (Tuple a mempty)`
- `listen (writer a x) = tell x $> Tuple a x`
declarations.title: MonadWriter

declarations.comments:
Projects a value from modifications made to the accumulator during an
action.
declarations.title: listens

declarations.comments: Modify the final accumulator value by applying a function.
declarations.title: censor

declarations.comments:
The writer monad transformer.

This monad transformer extends the base monad with a monoidal accumulator of
type `w`.

The `MonadWriter` type class describes the operations supported by this monad.
declarations.title: WriterT

process, we create monad transformer _stacks_, which contain all of the effects
required for a particular computation.

The laws state that `lift` is a `Monad` morphism.

Laws:

- `lift (do { x <- m ; y }) = do { x <- lift m ; lift y }`
